node.title: The Glorious Monstrosities of Frita Batidos
node.plaintext:
Frita Batidos is one of the crown jewels of Ann Arbor, MI. It is a small cuban
street food restaurant in downtown Ann Arbor. While it may be a slight walk from
the University of Michigan campus, many students make the trek despite any
ridiculous weather conditions to get a bite of these burgers.

They have the one of the most delicious, insanely huge and jam packed burgers
I’ve ever eaten in my life. No matter the patty you want inside your burger,
whether it be black bean, chicken, or chorizo, you’re bound to get a tasty
concoction which will blow your mind. Honestly I have yet to meet a person at
the University of Michigan who doesn’t like their burgers.

The basic burger (or Frita) is simple, just the patty between two egg buns and
stuffed with fries. I also added some cilantro-lime salsa and tropical slaw to
juice it up a little. Safe to say, I don’t think I would be trying to impress
anyone while eating this monstrosity.



My brother always goes with a sunny side up egg and avocado spread on his frita.
As soon as you bite into the burger, the yolk bursts, spreading that wonderful
flavor into every bite thereafter.



This trip to Frita Batidos was special because we brought one of my friends here
for her first time. She decided to go big or go home and made her frita “loco.”
This means that they just go “loco” and add ALL of their available toppings on
top of your burger: muenster, a sunny side up egg, cilantro lime salsa, tropical
slaw, AND avocado spread! This is pretty much the mother of all burgers. I mean
its GINORMOUS. My friend wasn’t even able to attempt to eat this with her hands.
But oh was it delicious.



Don’t get me started on their garlic-cilantro fries. Frita Batidos has some of
the simplest yet most amazing fries I’ve had. I can’t even describe them, you
have to try them yourself!



If you are ever in Ann Arbor MAKE SURE  you head to downtown to taste one of
these monstrosities, these glorious monstrosities of Frita Batidos.

Check them out [http://www.fritabatidos.com]!
